title: The Easiest Most Abundant Edible Plants to Grow in a Garden - Gardening in a Cold Climate

tasks.task: Growing and preserving easy and abundant crops in a colder climate
subtasks: Planting and growing potatoes, pumpkins, zucchinis, beans, carrots, beets, radishes, turnips, onions, garlic, and fruit trees
Harvesting and storing crops through canning, freezing, dehydrating, and fermenting
Growing and harvesting herbs and greens like basil, dill, arugula, kale, and mustard greens
Preserving foods through methods like making sauerkraut and jams
Planting and caring for perennials such as rhubarb and Jerusalem artichokes
Joining local gardening communities, volunteering at farms, and learning from more experienced gardeners
